basic_info.name: Aravali College of Engineering and Management Placement
description: Aravali College of Engineering and Management offers placements to all the candidates through its Training and Placement Cell i.e. The Student Career Development Cell which works toward the fulfillment of the student’s requirements and desire to have the best professional career. It also provides access to employers by generating an ample number of opportunities for placement and brings awareness among the faculty and the students to prepare according to the changing demands of the industry.

The Training and Placement Cell at Aravali College of Engineering & Management always strives to achieve the much-required balance between academics and industry exposure and a lot of initiatives are being taken in this direction. Every year the college conducts industry visits, training sessions, internship and placement sessions for students.

During the placement session of 2019-2020, 74 companies visited the campus to recruit students from the college. The recruiters included some of the well-reputed names and tech giants such as Kotak Life Insurance, Genpact, Madhyam Technologies Pvt Ltd, HDFC Ergo Life, Just Dial Ltd, Sony India, Wipro HR Services India Ltd., 360 Degree Cloud Technologies Pvt. Ltd and many more.

Section.name: About ACEM
Section.description:
Aravali College of Engineering and Management (ACEM) is a Private Institute located in Faridabad, Haryana. It is promoted by Mr. Dhan Singh Bhadana, the Chairman of the Aravali Eduworld. ACEM is affiliated to MDU, Rohtak and is approved by AICTE. The main aim of the institute is to provide excellent quality education in the field of technology and management not only to the students from Delhi/ NCR region but also from all over the world.
The courses offered by the Institute are B.Tech., B.Tech. (Lateral), BBA and MBA. Admission is granted on the basis of marks scored in qualifying entrance examinations such as JEE Mains, LEET and CMAT respectively.

Ques. How is the Aravali College of Engineering and Management?
Ans. Aravali College of Engineering and Management is among the reputed private colleges of its kind. The institute offers best in class education, aided by its advanced infrastructure and qualified faculty. The institute also provides several placement opportunities to students via its placement cell. Students get job offers from companies like HDFC Ergo Life, Just Dial Ltd, Sony India, Wipro HR Services India Ltd., 360 Degree Cloud Technologies Pvt. Ltd, Kotak Life Insurance, Genpact, Madhyam Technologies Pvt Ltd and many more.
Ques. How to apply for admission to the MBA course at Aravali College of Engineering and Management?
Ans. Candidates will first have to register themselves to the college. While registering, they will have to pay the registration fee as required by the college. After registration, the candidate can visit the official website of the college. Go to the download section of the website. Here they can download the application form and the prospectus. After carefully filling in the application form, the application form can be submitted to the college with the required documents. The application form can also be acquired from the campus itself.
Ques. Are there scholarships available for students?
Ans. Yes, the institute offers three types of scholarships to students. New candidates can avail scholarships that are determined by their score in 10+2 and/or JEE Main rank. Existing students are offered scholarships on the basis of merit in the scholarship test at the university and institute level.
